availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Crutcher (Mercer County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer. Kentucky native. Married Margaret Cook Crutcher in Mercer County,Kentucky in January 1846. Father of Thomas E. Crutcher, S. W. Crutcher, Peter P. Crutcher, Amanda Crutcher, Kate Crutcher, Bettie Crutcher, and Sarah Crutcher. Carpenter in Jessamine County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Jessamine County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 42B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 86.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 752-753.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. 56A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 42B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191859, p. 726.
Find A Grave, "James P. Crutcher (1822-1888)," Memorial #35167849, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35167849 (accessed October 9, 2019).
